text: José Manuel Zozaya y Bermúdez (4 July 1778 – 21 June 1853) was the first Mexican diplomat to ever represent his country in the United States, serving as Envoy Extraordinary and Minister Plenipotentiary from 12 December 1822 to 20 May 1823. Aside from his diplomatic activities, Zozaya served as attorney- in-fact of Agustín de Iturbide, as congressman for Guanajuato (1820), as auditor for the Army, and operated the first paper mill in the history of Mexico.Footnote of Carlos María de Bustamante in ==Works== * (1839). * (1841). ==Notes and references== Category:1778 births Category:1853 deaths Category:People from Salvatierra, Guanajuato Category:Politicians from Guanajuato Category:Ambassadors of Mexico to the United States Category:Members of the Chamber of Deputies (Mexico) Category:Presidents of the Chamber of Deputies (Mexico)
